Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
How long wilt thou speak these <FI>things<Fi>? and <FI>how long shall<Fi> the words of thy mouth <FI>be like<Fi> a strong wind?
Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;<RF>for…: Heb. in the hand of their transgression<Rf>
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
If thou <FI>wert<Fi> pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.<CM>
For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
(For we <FI>are but of<Fi> yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth <FI>are<Fi> a shadow:)<RF>nothing: Heb. not<Rf>
Shall not they teach thee, <FI>and<Fi> tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
Whilst it <FI>is<Fi> yet in his greenness, <FI>and<Fi> not cut down, it withereth before any <FI>other<Fi> herb.
So <FI>are<Fi> the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:
Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust <FI>shall be<Fi> a spider's web.<RF>web: Heb. house<Rf>
He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
He <FI>is<Fi> green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
His roots are wrapped about the heap, <FI>and<Fi> seeth the place of stones.
If he destroy him from his place, then <FI>it<Fi> shall deny him, <FI>saying<Fi>, I have not seen thee.
Behold, this <FI>is<Fi> the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.<CM>
Behold, God will not cast away a perfect <FI>man<Fi>, neither will he help the evil doers:<RF>help…: Heb. take the ungodly by the hand<Rf>
Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.<RF>rejoicing: Heb. shouting for joy<Rf>
They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.<RF>shall come…: Heb. shall not be<Rf><CM>
